subject: History
title: The Zimmermann Telegram
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Zimmermann Telegram.

hook.text: A single decoded message pulled the United States into World War Iâ€”and sealed Germany's defeat.

buildup.text: In January 1917, Germany's foreign secretary Arthur Zimmermann sent a secret telegram to Mexico.

discovery.text: It proposed a military alliance: if Mexico attacked the US, Germany would help reclaim Texas and Arizona.

twist.text: Room 40 decoded it but couldn't reveal howâ€”so they staged a burglary in Mexico to 'discover' a copy.

climax.text: When published, American outrage was immediate. Congress declared war on Germany two months later.

punchline.text: One telegram tipped the balance of a world war.

quiz.question: What did the Zimmermann Telegram propose to Mexico?
options: A peace treaty to end the war in Europe
A military alliance against the United States
An economic partnership for shared oil rights
